meanings.definition: Consisting of two parts or elements
meanings.sent1: The puzzle had a duple design with two matching pieces.
meanings.sent2: The bookshelf was made of duple shelves, each with a different color.
meanings.sent3: The duple pattern on the wallpaper made it look like a mirrored room.
meanings.sent4: Her duple earrings perfectly complemented her outfit, creating a harmonious look.
meanings.sent5: The duple structure of the molecule made it stable and balanced.

meanings.definition: Having two beats in a measure
meanings.sent1: The song had a duple rhythm that was easy to dance to.
meanings.sent2: The musician played a duple melody on the piano, tapping his foot to the beat.
meanings.sent3: The duple tempo of the music made everyone clap in unison.
meanings.sent4: Her heart beat in a duple rhythm, steady and strong.
meanings.sent5: The duple drumming echoed through the hall, setting the pace for the dancers.
